keyword: calories in one cup of pasta
title: Calories in One Cup of Pasta
meta_description: Discover calories in one cup of pasta, including carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in One Cup of Pasta
assumptions: Cooked plain pasta (e.g., spaghetti or penne), drained, no sauce, oil, or salt added; 1 cup ≈140 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by pasta type, brand, cooking method, portion size, and added ingredients. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of cooked plain pasta provides ~221 kcal and ~8 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of cooked pasta?
faqs.a: About 221 kcal for one cup of plain cooked pasta.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one cup of pasta?
faqs.a: Approximately 43 g carbs, with 2.5 g fiber.
One cup has ~8 g protein; pair with meat or beans for more.

faqs.q: How does dry vs. cooked pasta calories differ?
faqs.a: Dry pasta is denser; 1 cup dry ≈370 kcal, expands when cooked.
Yes—whole grain or gluten-free may vary slightly in calories and macros.
